intro: Scrophularia aintabensis, commonly known as the Aintab scrophularia, is a flowering plant species native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes numerous herbs and shrubs. The plant typically features showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with a distinctive two-lipped structure. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
